trans-unit.source: Creates a user-selectable list of data source names.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class is a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> object that is typically referenced by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute.

The data source names that are returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method are of components from the container of the specified context that are valid data sources.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> method gets a value indicating whether the returned data source names are an exclusive list of possible values.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method gets a value indicating whether the data source names are a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method converts the specified object to the native type of the converter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> method gets a value indicating whether this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.IsValidDataSource%2A> method indicates whether the specified component implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class when the class is referenced by a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the specified source type to the native type of the converter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method can only convert from a string, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> only returns `true` when `sourcetype` is a string.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> does not use the `context` parameter.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the object for which conversion is being requested.
`true` if sourceType is a string; otherwise, `false`.
Converts the specified object to the native type of the converter.
If the `value` parameter has a type of string, it is returned as a string.
If `value` is `null`, an empty string ("") is returned.
Otherwise, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method does not use the `context` or `culture` parameter.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
A object that specifies the culture of the value parameter.
The object to convert.
The value parameter is returned as a string.
value is other than a string or `null`.
Returns a list of the available data source names.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method creates a list of the names of the components that are valid data sources in the container of the object that is specified by the `context` parameter.
It then converts that list to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> object.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> containing the names of the controls that implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource"></xref> interface and are available for use in the given context.
Gets a value indicating whether the returned data source names are an exclusive list of possible values.

If you derive a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter> class and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method to return an exclusive list of data source names, also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> method to return `true` when the data source name list is exclusive.
The `context` parameter is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A>.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
Always `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether this object returns a standard set of data source names that can be picked from a list.
The `context` parameter is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about a context to a type converter so that the type converter can perform a conversion.
Always `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specified component is a valid data source.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataSourceIDConverter.IsValidDataSource%2A> method considers the `component` parameter to be a valid data source if it implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> interface.
`true` if component is a valid data source; otherwise, `false`.
